page.title: 15British Rail at Birchwood
page.content: Birchwood Station was opened by Sir Peter Parker on July 31st,1981.This station is completely new,no station existed until the new town was built. It is unusual to have a new station in the 1980s.The trains run from Manchester Picadilly to Liverpool Lime Street,calling at 24 stations.The trains run every half-hour but are more frequent in the rush hour.They are diesel trains and usually have two coaches.At 11.00hrs on February 5th. 1986 14 people got off the Manchester train and 17 people boarded the train to Liverpool.Three people work on the station.They work 9 hour 45 minute shifts and have two days off each week.There are 33 rains each week day and 12 trains on Sundays.
